item.title: DAC Community Energy System Transformations
item.description: Recently I began work as the lead technical research scientist on a new CEC grant funded project investigating the potential co-benefits from the pursuit of various different energy related climate action policies within Southern California Disadvantaged Communities. This page will be updated with information regarding my work on this project as it unfolds.

item.title: New Website Design
item.description: An Explanation Periodically I find occasion to revisit the design and hosting architecture of my personal website. The previous version was a slick as goose-shit, single page sort of deal. It was built off of a template that was probably designed for a startup’s website or some creative person’s photo portfolio. I got to thinking about how such a flashy design, while nice, doesn’t really reflect the type of programming work that I do in my day to day life.

item.title: Contact
item.description: Some Advice Please don’t try to email me. Email is very useful for people whose job it is to stay on top of things. However, it is unbearably distracting for people, like me, whose job it is to get to the bottom of them. If you manage to find my phone number somewhere then I guess you can go ahead and give that a shot. Although, I must admit that I have a tendency to not pick up if I don’t recognize the caller.
